page.title: 01Landscape
page.content: The survey area takes its name from the former parish of LINDEAN,now integrated with the modern parish of Galashiels.Before the reorganisation of local government in 1975 it was part of the county of Selkirkshire.It is now in the District of Ettrick and Lauderdale and the Borders Region.In geographical terms it lies in the middle Tweed Basin and in that part where the Ettrick Water joins the River Tweed.On both sides of the river the land rises fairly steeply from 100m. in the valley bottom to about 300m. on the perimeters.In terms of land use it is best described as an upland mixed arable area with grassland-permanent and rotational-predominating.The trunk road-A7-closely follows the river course and provides a good line of communication with Selkirk.
